greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write U.S. English name for n (ignoring hyphens and spaces) and add numerical values of letters using a=1, b=2, ..., y=25, z=26.
comment: "and" is not used, e.g. 101 is rendered as "one hundred one" rather than "one hundred and one". - _Robert Israel_, Jun 12 2019
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
M. Hasler in reply to E. Angelini, English number words modulo themselves, SeqFan list, Jun 21 2013
example: "One" = 15 + 14 + 5 = 34 (o is 15th letter, n is 14th letter, e is 5th letter).
program: (PARI) A073327(n)=sum(i=1,#n=select(t->t>64,Vec(Vecsmall(English(n)))),n[i]%32) \\ see A052360 for English(). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 22 2013
xref: Cf. A119945 (German analog with offset 0). See the comment there on `251'.
results.author: _Paul Lusch_, Aug 22 2002
ext: a(0) added by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 30, 2008
More terms from _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Aug 30 2009
